repnme.cdata!:
Mexico - Fifth and Sixth Agricultural and
            Livestock Credit Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth and Sixth Agricultural Credit
            Projects for Mexico met or exceeded objectives and targets.
            The projects had a positive impact on lending to
            agriculture, institution building, and production and farm
            income, including that of low-income producers. The economic
            rate of return was about 34 percent for the Fifth project
            and 37 percent for the Sixth. The gap between agricultural
            interest rates on the one hand and inflation levels and
            commercial rates on the other hand progressively widened as
            no provisions were made for periodic adjustments. This
            impacted an accelerating demand for credit and a slow
            deterioration of the Borrower's sound financial
            position. Significant progress was made in two areas of
            institution building: expansion of training and evaluation
            system. As a result, the Borrower was able to expand
            markedly its technical assistance to participating banks and
            to provide for the first time sufficient details on the
            production impact of its investments. The Borrower's
            capabilities for sectorial analysis, planning, programming,
            and internal control of subloans proved less than adequate
            in the face of strongly expanded demand. These problems were
            addressed through the subsequent Seventh Project. Lessons
            learned up through the Sixth Project prompted designs in the
            Seventh Project to: strengthen the Borrower's planning
            mechanism and coordination with public agencies; provide an
            operating regulation and procedures manual to furnish
            direction and guidelines to participating banks in lending
            to agriculture; intensify training programs for the
            technical staff of the Borrower and participating banks in
            order to strengthen the credit and technical assistance
            delivery system; and strengthen and improve the
            Borrower's database system and its monitoring and
            evaluation capabilities.

repnme.cdata!:
Mexico - Fifth Agricultural and Livestock
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Agriculture and Livestock
            Project will provide term credit for investment in livestock
            production, annual and perennial crop production and
            agro-industries establishment. It will consist of (i) a
            low-income producers subproject (LIPS) tailored to the needs
            of the traditional small farmers; (ii) a medium-income
            producers' subproject (MIPS); (iii) an agro-industries
            subproject for groups of agricultural producers,
            predominantly ejidatarios and small farmers; and (iv) a
            program of applied research, training and monitoring.

Mexico - Fifth Agricultural and Livestock
            Credit Project

Mexico - Fifth Agricultural and
            Livestock Credit Project
